snippet: A law intended to prohibit bribery of foreign officials by United States businesses has led to more than $3 billion in settlements, but nine of the top 10 were with foreign companies.
abstract: Foreign Corrupt Practices Act, intended to prohibit bribery of foreign officials by United States businesses, has led to more than $3 billion in settlements, but nine of the top 10 were with foreign companies; since the law was enacted in 1977, the definition of 'American' has expanded greatly to include foreign firms that are listed on United States stock exchanges, sell securities or do business in the country.
lead_paragraph: A law intended to prohibit bribery of foreign officials by United States businesses has led to more than $3 billion in settlements, but nine of the top 10 were with foreign companies.

headline.seo: Bribery Settlements Under U.S. Law Are Mostly With Foreign Countries
headline.main: Foreign Firms Most Affected by a U.S. Law Barring Bribes
headline.print_headline: Foreign Firms Most Affected By a U.S. Law Barring Bribes
